start.description: Even if you have a super strong password, it's still a good idea to use 2 factor authentication (2FA) whenever you can. 2FA means you need two things to log into something. Usually that's a password, and a code you get from your phone or a text.

nextSteps.prompt: I'm in too much of a hurry.

platform.description: Lots of sites have an option for 2FA these days. Which do you want to set up first?

facebook.description: Facebook calls 2FA 'login approvals'. Follow their helpful instructions to get it set up!

twitter.description: Twitter calls 2FA 'login verification'. Follow their helpful instructions to get it set up!

lookitup.description: Try seraching for '2 factor auth' and the site your are using. They might have it! If not, using a password manager to have strong passwords is the second best thing.
